"you shoot on film"

no you don't, what fucking year are you in?

@meathane

They actually do shoot everything on film still to this day. The quality is incomparable to digital copies. Movie theaters still show movies off film. The highest quality IMAX films are, film.

@ MDJ.054

A lot of brand new movies are primarily shot on film, usually with Panasonic cameras, although they might use a digital camera for a specific shot or scene.  If no one shot on film anymore then why would the best Film Production program in the entire southeast teach 95% film and 5% digital?  And why would a solid film directed by Sidney Lumet, a highly revered director, with an award-winning cast, be poorly received and even somewhat disregarded by critics and the public strictly because it was shot in digital?

@dlectro 
That film was called "Before the Devil Knows You're Dead", it was shot in digital HD, as mentioned above.
any good torrents for season 6 that aren't like 550MB/episode?

@ MDJ.054:

Just wanted to add my 2 cents as well....uh, yeah, buddy, A LOT of films are still shot primarily on film. A good number are shot digital as well, but I wouldn't say it's a majority. What year are YOU living in that NOTHING is shot with physical film? I can name tons of films that have come out in the past 10 years that were shot on film with minimal/no digital filming.
